thread.title: L'Equipe Give Ruthless Player Ratings To Several Manchester City Players After Monaco Victory
thread.title_full: L'Equipe Give Ruthless Player Ratings To Several Manchester City Players After Monaco Victory

title: L'Equipe Give Ruthless Player Ratings To Several Manchester City Players After Monaco Victory
text:
L'Equipe Give Ruthless Player Ratings To Several Manchester City Players After Monaco Victory Wed Feb 22 2017 12:06:00   12:06:00 GMT+0000 (GMT) Jack Kenmare Jack Kenmare in football 
After Manchester City's 5-3 win over Monaco last night, defender John Stones admitted that he "needed to make amends" after allowing Radamel Falcao to delightfully chip Willy Caballero in the 61st minute. 
Thankfully for Manchester City and Pep Guardiola, the 22-year-old scored the crucial fourth goal and redeemed himself as goals from Raheem Sterling, Sergio Aguero and Leroy Sane sealed one of the most memorable Champions League nights in recent history. 
Despite the fact City secured a vital win, French publication L'Equipe have continued their ruthless streak by giving the likes of John Stones and Nicolas Otamendi poor ratings. 
Last week, L'Equipe put the final nail in the coffin with a flurry of terrible Barcelona player ratings after they lost 4-0 to PSG, and they've produced once again after Tuesday night's result. 
The likes of John Stones received a rating of 3/10 while Otamendi picked up a 2/10. 
: 
City may have been victorious in the Champions League against Monaco, but Graeme Souness insists Pep Guardiola and his players should count themselves very lucky.. 
Whilst Guardiola and his star-studded squad will take a lead to France in three weeks time, pundit for Irish TV Graeme Souness really didn't enjoy the City performance, particularly in the first-half: 
Here's what Graham Souness said about Guardiola's tactics: 
What do you make of Souness' comments? And have L'Equipe hit the nail on the head with the above ratings? 
Let us know.
